item.title: Afghanistan: Joe Biden defends US pull-out as Taliban claim victory
item.description: Staying in Afghanistan was not an option, the US president says, as Taliban militants celebrate.

item.title: Afghanistan: UK and Taliban in talks over further evacuations
item.description: A UK official is in Qatar for talks to secure the exit of both UK and Afghan nationals, No 10 says.

item.title: Covid: Universal credit top-up phasing out and vaccine contamination fears
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Wednesday morning.

item.title: Afghan refugees: Those who worked for UK can stay permanently
item.description: Evacuees who worked for the British military and UK government will be given indefinite leave to remain.

item.title: Life-saving cholesterol jab recommended on NHS
item.description: Inclisiran is a new treatment that works even when other fat-busting drugs, like statins, have not.

item.title: New eco-petrol baffles a quarter of motorists
item.description: E10 is set to become the new standard petrol, but 24% of drivers are unaware of it, says the RAC.

item.title: One in three trees face extinction in wild, says new report
item.description: Experts say 17,500 tree species are at risk around the world, including magnolias, oaks and maples.

item.title: Afghanistan: UK embassy told Afghans to go to Abbey Gate before suicide attack
item.description: Despite an attack being expected, emails seen by the BBC show embassy staff directing Afghans to the gate.

item.title: Afghanistan: The questions facing Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab
item.description: The foreign secretary will be grilled by MPs on the UK's withdrawal from Afghanistan.

item.title: Hurricane Ida: New Orleans under curfew amid blackout
item.description: Millions of homes remain without power across New Orleans and the wider region following Hurricane Ida.

item.title: Transfer deadline day: Premier League spending tops £1bn but is down on previous year
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo's move back to Manchester United on transfer deadline day helps to push Premier League clubs' spending past £1bn - but overall outlay has dropped.

item.title: US Open 2021: Emma Raducanu wins on New York main-draw debut
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu again shows her talent and maturity on the Grand Slam stage as she eases to victory on her US Open main-draw debut.

item.title: Pair complete UK's longest straight-line challenge
item.description: Calum Maclean and Jenny Graham climbed mountains, scrambled down gullies and tackled steep rocky crags on the route.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: UK in talks with Taliban and new 'miracle jab'
item.description: The front pages focus on the Western withdrawal from Afghanistan and a new drug to prevent heart attacks.

item.title: Drugs: The county lines gang in our Powys cul-de-sac
item.description: What happens when drug dealers move in to a small, rural town?

item.title: Football fan credits daughter with changing his racist beliefs
item.description: Football fan Neil says he changed his attitude with the help of his daughter, Millie.

item.title: Family of ducks waddles through University of Nottingham library
item.description: The mother and her ducklings were "calm and unflustered" as they walked around George Green Library.

item.title: Why was this athlete 'too tall' to race?
item.description: Blake Leeper fought to compete with able-bodied athletes, but his blades were deemed too long.

item.title: Wildlife photo: Is this the world's most beautiful mosquito?
item.description: Both beauty and beast. A Sabethes mosquito is visually stunning but it's also a carrier of disease.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'I was making money, but had no money'
item.description: Honey boss Scott Davies says cash flow problems meant though he was profitable he "had no money".

item.title: The best of British press photography
item.description: Images from an exhibition of the best 100 from members of the British Press Photographers' Association.

item.title: Dave Grohl performs with Nandi Bushell, 11, at Foo Fighters gig
item.description: Nandi Bushell joins the American rock band on stage in Los Angeles.

item.title: Gulf Sky: 'Our ship was hijacked and taken to Iran'
item.description: Former crew of the oil tanker Gulf Sky talk publically for the first time about the ship's disappearance.

item.title: Marseille drugs: Child victims of French city's vicious gang war
item.description: A 14-year-old is the latest victim of Marseille's gang war, prompting a key visit from President Macron.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Day-by-day guide to key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in the Tokyo Paralympic Games? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action.

item.title: Covid: How do I get the vaccine and will I need a booster?
item.description: All over-16s can now get the Covid vaccine, and booster jabs could be rolled out from September.

item.title: When will furlough end?
item.description: Employers will contribute more to the cost of keeping their staff furloughed from 1 August.

item.title: Sarah Rainsford: My last report before Russian expulsion
item.description: The BBC's Moscow correspondent files her final despatch after more than 20 years reporting in Russia.

item.title: Theranos scandal: Who is Elizabeth Holmes and why is she on trial?
item.description: The former boss of blood testing company Theranos is accused of fraud and could face years in jail.

item.title: Reid reaches last four at Paralympics as GB win two more bronzes
item.description: Defending champion Gordon Reid reaches the men's singles semi-final at the Tokyo Paralympics while Great Britain win two more bronzes.

item.title: Tsitsipas butt of jokes as Murray aims jibe in toilet break row
item.description: Stefanos Tsitsipas finds himself the butt of the jokes at the US Open after Andy Murray aims another jibe at the Greek third seed in the row over long bathroom breaks.

item.title: England v India: Virat Kohli faces questions over batting and captaincy
item.description: Virat Kohli's aggressive leadership inspires India at times, but it looks childish when it doesn't come off, says cricket journalist Suresh Menon.

item.title: Barcelona's Griezmann rejoins Atletico
item.description: La Liga champions Atletico Madrid re-sign forward Antoine Griezmann from Barcelona on a one-year loan deal.

item.title: Transfer Deadline Day: Daniel James' best Premier League goals for Manchester United
item.description: Watch some of Daniel James' best Premier League goals for Manchester United, as the Wales forward moves from Old Trafford to Leeds United.

item.title: Toyko Paralympics: Sarah Storey wins 16th gold after C5 time trial victory
item.description: Watch the moment Sarah Storey became Britain's joint-most successful Paralympic athlete, winning the women's C5 time trial to earn her 16th gold medal.

item.title: Amid violent reprisals, Afghans fear the Taliban's 'amnesty' was empty
item.description: Reports suggest the Taliban are searching for, and allegedly killing, people they pledged to leave in peace.

item.title: Afghanistan: How can the West stop terror bases?
item.description: The foreign secretary says the UK will fight ISIS by all means available - but what does that mean?

item.title: Afghanistan: 'Struggle to survive or race to escape' on streets of Kabul
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from the Afghan capital, a day after the last US troops left.

item.title: What equipment was left behind by US forces?
item.description: As US troops took off from Kabul, they abandoned 73 aircraft - all disabled.

item.title: Liverpool man trapped in Afghanistan pleads for help
item.description: The Liverpool taxi driver travelled to the country about two weeks ago to help his family flee.

item.title: Afghanistan: How many refugees are there and where will they go?
item.description: Thousands of people are scrambling to flee Afghanistan after the Taliban took control of the country.

item.title: Afghanistan: Fleeing the Taliban into Pakistan and leaving dreams behind
item.description: The BBC speaks to Afghans fleeing the Taliban into Pakistan at the Chaman Spin Boldak border.

item.title: From Bush to Biden: One war, four US presidents on Afghanistan
item.description: Two decades of conflict in Afghanistan shaped the legacies of each of these commanders-in-chief.

item.title: Taliban are back - what next for Afghanistan?
item.description: As the Taliban take power after 20 years of conflict, what did the war achieve and what happens now?

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Who are Great Britain's medal winners?
item.description: A list of the Great Britain medal winners from the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics.

item.title: Which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table for the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics? How are Great Britain getting on?

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: What you need to know about Paralympic classification
item.description: From KL1 to PT2 and F11 to SB6 - everything you need to know about classification at the Paralympic Games.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sport-by-sport guide
item.description: Twenty-two sports will feature in the Tokyo Paralympics - find out more about them all here.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Afghanistan athlete Hossain Rasouli makes debut after evacuation
item.description: Afghanistan evacuee Hossain Rasouli finally gets his chance to compete at the Tokyo Paralympics - and his opponents can't "help but feel joy".

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Eight Great Britain athletes to watch at Games
item.description: From the 'Weirwolf' to a potential swimming star, who are some of the Great Britain athletes hoping to shine at the Tokyo Paralympics?

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Eight global athletes to watch at Games
item.description: From the Blade Jumper to the dancing star and the Tik Tok influencer, meet some of the global athletes hoping to make an impact at the Tokyo Paralympics.

item.title: Afghanistan: Shukria Barakzai's whispered voice notes and dramatic escape
item.description: The desperate messages sent by Afghan politician Shukria Barakzai to a UK MP as the Taliban tried to hunt her down.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'undefeated' Panjshir Valley - an hour from Kabul
item.description: The Panjshir Valley has been a flashpoint in Afghanistan's turbulent history - now it's happening again.

item.title: Bilal Sarwary: 'The plane hit the tower and all our lives changed'
item.description: Afghan journalist Bilal Sarwary was selling carpets when 9/11 happened. From that day on, everything changed.

item.title: Shot in the head in Angola, left for dead, now a Wetherspoons star
item.description: Cesar Kimbirima fled Angola after being shot four times and spending five months in a coma.

item.title: Michael Knighton: The man who could have bought Man Utd for £10m but walked away
item.description: In August 1989, Michael Knighton celebrated his Manchester United takeover deal at Old Trafford. But the plotting against him had just begun.
